title: Aston Villa 12 - 1 to win from behind against Bayern Munich
body_text:
Week two of the UEFA Champions League kicks off this evening with a selection of blockbuster ties scheduled over the next two nights.
As well as bringing you all the odds ahead of the latest round of action, bet365 is once again giving fans the chance to win up to £250,000 through the free-to-play '6 Scores Challenge Predictor' game.
The free-to-play game gives customers the opportunity to win the jackpot by correctly predicting the score of six pre-selected fixtures.
Players will win a share of £20,000 for predicting five correct scores, with a share of £10,000 also available for four correct scores.
Free spins are also available on selected games for players who get one, two or three correct predictions.
6 Scores Challenge fixtures:
Bayer Leverkusen v Milan (Tuesday, October 1 - 8pm)
Arsenal v PSG (Tuesday, October 1 - 8pm)
Aston Villa v Bayern Munich (Wednesday, October 2 - 8pm)
Benfica v Atletico Madrid (Wednesday, October 2 - 8pm)
Lille v Real Madrid (Wednesday, October 2 - 8pm)
Leipzig v Juventus (Wednesday, October 2 - 8pm)
To celebrate its historic sponsorship of the competition and becoming the first official sports betting partner of the UEFA Champions League, bet365 is continuing with one of the largest ticket giveaways in the competition’s history.
Thousands of football fans in some of the biggest UCL nations will be given the opportunity to experience a UEFA Champions League match day, with bet365 providing access to some of the most sought-after seats in football.
You can enter using the link further below. And to help you place your bets, we’ve previewed a selection of fixtures ahead of kickoff.
Arsenal v PSG
Arsenal head into this blockbuster European fixture after rising to third place in the Premier League, following their 4-2 win over Leicester City at the weekend.
Mikel Arteta’s men will be up against an in-form PSG, who remained at the French summit following Friday’s 3-1 triumph at home to Rennes.
The French champions have never won the UEFA Champions League, but came close last season when they reached the semi-finals of the competition. They were eventually knocked out after suffering a 2-0 aggregate loss to Borussia Dortmund.
After winning six of their seven league matches, they will be confident ahead of their trip to north London, despite losing their three previous matches on English shores.
Arsenal 8/11, Draw 11/4, PSG 15/4
Result/both teams to score:
- To win from behind: Arsenal 7/1 / PSG 14/1
- To win to nil: Arsenal 9/4 / PSG 8/1
- To win either half: Arsenal 2/5 / PSG 6/4
- To win both halves: Arsenal 4/1 / PSG 16/1
- To score in both halves: Arsenal 13/8 / PSG 4/1
Slovan Bratislava v Man City
Manchester City have drawn three of their last four games in all competitions ahead of this match against the Slovakian champions. However, they will still be confident of a win following their 0-0 Champions League opener against Inter Milan.
Despite once again sitting top of the table in their domestic league, Slovan were hammered 5-1 by Celtic in their opening game.
Guardiola's side scored exactly three goals in all five of their UEFA Champions League away games last season, and will be hoping for another high-scoring outing on Tuesday evening.
Slovan Bratislava 33/1, Draw 12/1, Man City 1/22
Result/both teams to score:
- To win from behind: Slovan Bratislava 100/1 / Man City 7/1
- To win to nil: Slovan Bratislava 50/1 / Man City 8/15
- To win either half: Slovan Bratislava 10/1 / Man City 1/33
- To win both halves: Slovan Bratislava 100/1 / Man City 4/7
- To score in both halves: Slovan Bratislava 16/1 / Man City 4/11
Aston Villa v Bayern Munich
Unai Emery’s resurgent Aston Villa team welcome six-time Champions League winners Bayern Munich to Villa Park for a mouthwater clash.
Despite a 40-year absence from Europe, The Villans looked looked like they had never been away after a straightforward 3-0 victory over Young Boys in their opening match.
It means Villa have now won five of their last six matches across all competitions. However, they go into this fixture following a surprise 2-2 draw with Ipswich Town at the weekend.
On the other hand, Vincent Kompany’s Bayern side remain unbeaten across all competitions this season, and brushed aside Dinamo Zagreb 9-2 in their opening Champions League fixture.
Aston Villa 10/3, Draw 16/5, Bayern Munich 7/10
Result/both teams to score:
- To win from behind: Aston Villa 12/1 / Bayern Munich 11/2
- To win to nil: Aston Villa 9/1 / Bayern Munich 11/4
- To win in ether half: Aston Villa 11/8 / Bayern Munich 4/11
- To win both halves: Aston Villa 14/1 / Bayern Munich 7/2
- To score in both halves: Aston Villa 3/1 / Bayern Munich 5/4
Liverpool v Bologna
Liverpool take on Bologna on Wednesday evening in new manager Arne Slot's first European fixture at Anfield, and they head into the match as clear favourites for the three points against an opponent they have never previously faced.
This is the Italian side’s first-ever season competing in the Champions League, and comes after they picked up a point against Shakhtar Donetsk in their opening game.
Bologna sit 18th in the new Champions League table, and it will be a huge task if they are to pick up their first win in the competition.
The Reds have only lost one match in all competitions this season, registering an away win against heavyweights AC Milan in Europe two weeks ago.
Liverpool 1/5, Draw 11/2, Bologna 14/1
Result/both teams to score:
- To win from behind: Liverpool 11/2 / Bologna 33/1
- To win to nil: Liverpool 10/11 / Bologna 22/1
- To win either half: Liverpool 1/9 / Bologna 9/2
- To win both halves: Liverpool 5/4 / Bologna 50/1
- To score in both halves: Liverpool 8/11 / Bologna 10/1
